title: Singer Ed Sheeran is special guest at care home as he opens suite named after himself
text:
Singer Ed Sheeran is special guest at care home as he opens suite named after himself Singer Ed Sheeran is special guest at care home as he opens suite named after himself 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Ed Sheeran proved what a down-to-earth, genuine guy he is when he took time out from conquering the world with his music to visit a care home in his home town. 
The Lego House singer visited residents and cut the ribbon for their new, aptly named Sheeran Suite. 
Global superstar Ed visited the Mills Meadow care home in Framlingham, Suffolk, with his mother and father. (Care UK/PA) 
Mills Meadow’s home manager, Sue Hill, said: “We are over the moon that Ed could visit us and officially open our new Sheeran Suite. Ed is delightful, we are really grateful that he could spare the time in his busy schedule to pop in and meet us and see our wonderful new facilities here.” 
Ed took the time to go on a tour around the home, which features four suites, each highlighting a local point of interest, with names chosen by residents and colleagues of the home. 
Resident Mary Swan, who helped Ed cut the ribbon, said: “It was a very exciting day and I enjoyed meeting Ed. I even got his autograph!” (Care UK/PA) 
Among the residents Ed met is former Bletchley Park codebreaker, Liz Austin. 
Care UK said a special thanks to Ed, and gave him a £500 cheque for his charity of choice, which is EACH (East Anglian Children’s Hospice). Share article 
The singer was also given a Lego set from the home’s residents. Promoted Stories
